tier.item: `You made him sad (caused him to be in a state of sadness).'
`You made him sad (caused him to be in a state of sadness).'
You made him sad (caused him to be in a state of sadness).
`I embarrassed him (caused him to be in a state of shame).'
`I embarrassed him (caused him to be in a state of shame).'
I embarrassed him (caused him to be in a state of shame).
(`He caused himself to be in a state of being human (Amerindian).')
(`He caused himself to be in a state of being human (Amerindian).')
He became an Amerindian (=he amerindianized himself).
He caused himself to be in a state of being human (Amerindian).
I am turning my child around.
`I went down the slope of the mountain.'
`I went down the slope of the mountain.'
I went down the slope of the mountain.
waku `belly' waku-ta `get a big belly (in pregnancy)'
`Where will I wake up (where will I be as it is dawning)?'
`Where will I wake up (where will I be as it is dawning)?'
Where will I wake up (where will I be as it is dawning)?
`He is evoking the spirits of the tree animals.'
`He is evoking the spirits of the tree animals.'
He is evoking the spirits of the tree animals.
I am providing him/her with work.
